entries.content: It is a great myth that good salesmen can convince. A man convinced against his will is of the same opinion still.
entries.notes: Highlights the futility of direct persuasion, especially against an existing view or solution.

entries.content: Good salesmen enable the prospect to discover they need what they have.
entries.notes: Focuses on facilitating prospect's self-realization of need/value rather than pushing.

entries.content: In the 'sell me this pen' scenario, demonstrating value by creating a situation where the prospect discovers they need the pen back.
entries.notes: Illustrates enabling discovery by temporarily removing the existing item.

entries.content: Is there anything about this particular pen that you're particularly attracted to or have a particular affinity with?
entries.notes: Used to understand the prospect's attachment (or lack thereof) to their current solution without criticizing it.

entries.content: You wouldn't care if you didn't have it?
entries.notes: Confirms the prospect's low perceived value or attachment to the current solution.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
